lines.text: Rollo Treadway - Heir to the Treadway fortune - a living proof that every family tree must have its sap... Buster Keaton.

[to the servant]
I think I'll get married.
[Servant responds briefly before Rollo turns his attention back to the portrait of Betsy]
Our story deals with one of those queer tricks that Fate sometimes plays.
He had completed all arrangements - except to notify the girl.
[Rollo shakes Betsy's hand and presents her with a bouquet]

[to the doorman]
I think a long walk would do me good.
Gentlemen, the enemy have just purchased the steamship Navigator.
[Walks over to open the double doors, and gestures to a vessel outside]

There she lies now, and it is our patriotic duty to destroy that ship. We will send her adrift in the fog tonight before the new crew goes aboard. The wind - the tide - and the rocks will do the rest.

[shakes her head]
This is a fine time to ask me that. I'm cold and hungry and ...
[both run off to anchor the ship]
We are sinking! It's just a matter of time until we're captured.

[shakes his head]
That would have to be fixed from the outside.
